import React from "react"; import axios from "axios"; import {useParams, useLocation} from "react-router-dom" const Movie = () => { const location = useLocation() const id = location.pathname.slice(7) const [movie, setMovie] = React.useState("") React.useEffect(() => { axios.get(`/api/movies/${id}`) .then((re) => re.data) .then((data) => setMovie(data)) }, "") console.log(movie) /* const movies = useParams(); const [peliculas, setPeliculas] = React.useState([]); React.useEffect(() => { axios .get("/api/movies/search/:" + movies.id) .then((re) => re.data) .then((data) => { setPeliculas(data.results); }); }, [movies]); console.log(peliculas); */ return ( <> {/*

Saint Basil's Cathedral

Moscow - Russia

{movie.overview, "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA"}

*/}

Saint Basil's Cathedral

Moscow - Russia

The Cathedral of Vasily the Blessed (Russian: Собор Василия Блаженного, Sobor Vasiliya Blazhennogo), commonly known as Saint Basil's Cathedral, is a church in Red Square in Moscow, Russia. The building, now a museum, is officially known as the Cathedral of the Intercession of the Most Holy Theotokos on the Moat (Russian: Собор Покрова Пресвятой Богородицы, что на Рву, Sobor Pokrova Presvyatoy Bogoroditsy, chto na Rvu) or Pokrovsky Cathedral (Russian: Покровский собор).[5] It was built from 1555–1561 on orders from Ivan the Terrible and commemorates the capture of Kazan and Astrakhan.

); }; export default Movie;
